articles.description: The latest football news and reaction as Newcastle see off Manchester United, Ipswich shock Chelsea and Aston Villa draw with Brighton.
articles.title: Newcastle beat helpless Man Utd & Ipswich stun Chelsea - Premier League reaction

articles.description: It is 50 years since Manchester United were relegated, but boss Ruben Amorim says it is "a possibility" that history could repeat itself.
articles.title: Manchester United: Relegation 'a possibility' says Ruben Amorim

articles.description: Plymouth Argyle have parted company with Wayne Rooney following the side's defeat to Oxford United.
articles.title: Wayne Rooney leaves Plymouth Argyle with side bottom of Championship

articles.description: Matching Ricky Ponting and beating Steve Smith, those close to Sam Konstas tell BBC Sport about his journey to international cricket.
articles.title: Sam Konstas: Teenage Australia opener's journey to India Test in Melbourne

articles.description: Nick Kyrgios is unsure whether he will be fit enough to compete at the Australian Open after his first singles match in 18 months left him in "throbbing" pain.
articles.title: Brisbane International: Nick Kyrgios loses on singles comeback before Novak Djokovic earns win

articles.description: Detroit Lions quarterback Jared Goff throws three touchdown passes during his side's 40-34 win against the San Francisco 49ers.
articles.title: Jared Goff stars in Detroit Lions' win against San Francisco 49ers

articles.description: Teenager Luke Littler survives a massive scare but beats Ryan Joyce 4-3 to reach the quarter-finals of the PDC World Darts Championship.
articles.title: PDC World Darts Championship 2025 results: Luke Littler survives scare to reach quarter-finals

articles.description: Barcelona lose another appeal to register Spain midfielder Dani Olmo for the second half of the season, one day before the deadline.
articles.title: Dani Olmo: Barcelona lose another appeal to register Spain midfielder one day before deadline

articles.description: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha is banned for two games by the Football Association following his clash with Ipswich security last month.
articles.title: Matheus Cunha: Wolverhampton Wanderers striker banned for two games

articles.description: Manchester United and Manchester City could sign Dani Olmo for free, Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold, and Alexander Isak will stay at Newcastle if they finish in the top four.
articles.title: Football gossip: Olmo, Alexander-Arnold, Isak, Delap, Ronaldo, McAtee, Wood
